title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must make a defensible claim that establishes a line of reasoning as to whether a regime change towards authoritarianism would be supported by citizens using one or more of the provided course concepts: political stability, civil society, economic development.

For Task B, the response supports the claim with one or two pieces of specific and relevant evidence from one or more course countries. The evidence is relevant to one or more of the provided course concepts. Tasks B1 and B2 represent each piece of evidence. Task B is worth 2 points in total.

For Task C, the response uses reasoning to explain why the evidence supports the claim or thesis, using one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task D, the response develops an opposing or alternate perspective using refutation, concession, or rebuttal.

For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A. For a student to earn the point for Task D, they must first earn the point for Task A.
